statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Michigan 82, UTEP 67
article.story: ANN ARBOR, Mich. (AP) -- Chris Hunter scored a season-high 20 points and Dion Harris added 18 to lead Michigan to its sixth straight postseason win, an 82-67 victory over Texas-El Paso in the first round of the NIT Thursday. Jason Williams had 25 points and Miguel Ayala added 10 for the Miners (21-10), who have not won consecutive postseason games since their 1992 run to the NCAA tournament's round of 16. Michigan (19-10), the 2004 NIT champion, broke a three-game losing streak and will host Notre Dame in a second-round game Monday. The Wolverines defeated the Fighting Irish 71-67 at South Bend, Ind., on Dec. 3. The Miners wore 1966-style jerseys to honor the school's only NCAA champion, but none of that magic came with the uniforms. UTEP turned over the ball 19 times and never made a serious run at the Wolverines after falling behind early. UTEP trimmed the lead to eight points with 12 minutes to play in the second half, but Michigan answered with a 12-0 run to put the game away. Hunter scored the last eight points of the streak. The Wolverines went on a 14-4 run early in the first half to take a lead they'd never lose. They were 7-for-11 from 3-point range in the opening 20 minutes and led 44-34 at halftime. Daniel Horton had 14 points and nine assists for Michigan, which also got 10 points from Brent Petway.
